newsitem.title: POLAND: Espebepe fate in hands of creditors.
newsitem.headline: Espebepe fate in hands of creditors.

text.p: Polish construction firm Espebepe will be saved from bankruptcy if it clinches a debt write-off deal with major creditors even though a small creditor has filed for Espebepe's bankruptcy, its president said.
Andrzej Hass told Reuters his firm would not fold even though Stako Sp. zoo, a Krakow-based creditor of Espebepe, filed for the construction firm's bankruptcy on Tuesday.
"A motion for the bankruptcy of our firm filed by Stako will not cause us to declare bankruptcy because these debts are disputable," Hass said on Wednesday.
Hass said that if creditors refused to write-off 95 percent of Espebepe's 74.6-million-zloty debt when the two sides met on Friday, the firm would file for bankruptcy.
"If on Friday we will not make an agreement with the creditors, then Espebepe's management will file for bankruptcy," he said.
Hass said a plan which envisioned Espebepe issuing convertible bonds was not realistic because there was not enough time.
He said that if the write-off deal came through, and Espebepe received new orders while reducing its workforce by some 300 employees, the firm could break even in 1997.
